name: John Carroll

locations.description: First Bishop of Baltimore, founder of American hierarchy

summary: John Carroll was the first Roman Catholic bishop and archbishop in the United States. A former Jesuit, he played a crucial role in establishing the Catholic Church in the newly independent United States. He founded Georgetown University in 1789 and worked to establish the Church's place in American society, navigating the relationship between Church and state in the new republic. His leadership laid the foundation for the growth of Catholicism in America.
